item.title: Ghost of Yotei Gets Early Praise from Former PlayStation Executive
item.description: Shuhei Yoshida recently revealed he had the chance to try out an early build for Ghost of Yotei. On the Easy Allies podcast, Yoshida commented on his experience of the game. He said it felt great and that he is looking forward to the game.

item.title: Most Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Players Have Never Met These NPCs
item.description:
With over 2.75 million copies sold worldwide, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has far surpassed the expectations set by its predecessor. And when seeing what the sequel delivered to fans of the original game, it’s easy to see what caused this universal praise. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 promises and delivers more of what made its predecessor stand out in a sea of open-world RPGs: a deeply immersive historical setting where realism, routine, and interpersonal bonds rule the day. Unlike the bustling, quest-heavy towns of other popular RPGs, Warhorse Studios favors the more subtle approach to storytelling in KCD2 . The game’s design is one that rewards curiosity and patience.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is well-regarded due to its immersive storytelling and distinguished cast of characters that make such a specific moment in history come to life. Among this cast of characters that transport players back to Bohemia are hundreds of NPCs that populate the map. From village rapscallions looking for a bar brawl to simple passersby on the road, the NPC encounters in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 are abundant. The unpredictable paths of certain NPCs and the specific chain of events necessary to discover them make some characters incredibly easy to miss. In fact, it is safe to say that most players will likely never encounter some NPCs in their Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 playthroughs unless they go out of their way to meet them. These characters may not necessarily advance the main storyline, but they leave lasting impressions on those who find them.

Rare Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 NPC - Karel Arrowhead

A character who can only be found by happenstance in a video game is rare. Still, in this case, it showcases Warhorse Studios’ attention to detail and the unlikely “what-ifs” that enhance the player experience. Karel Arrowhead, or the “Sleeping Man,” is one of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 ’s most elusive NPCs. His name comes from the fact that he has a piece of metal arrowhead sticking out of his forehead like a horn. He insists his arrow is imbued with magic that makes him invincible — a direct nod toward the detrimental effects of having an arrow lodged into one's skull. Unfortunately, Karel’s fate takes a turn for the worse.

Karel is found in Kuttenberg after a player has undertaken the Speak of the Devil mission. And even then, his window of availability is strikingly brief. Players who stray too far or delay their travels after completing the quest will risk missing him entirely. His appearance isn’t marked on the map, and the encounter lacks any kind of true fanfare. But for those who do travel south toward Grund immediately after the mission, Karel becomes a hilarious footnote in the broader world.

Rare Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 NPC - The Lady of Death (Or The White Lady)

Among the darkened roads of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , a nighttime traveler might stumble upon an unnerving sight: an elderly woman dressed entirely in white, walking alone through the stillness and humming a tune. She introduces herself calmly, claiming to be resting from her “work.” She describes her work as easing people’s pain and taking their suffering away. Her words carry a chilling ambiguity, and there’s a weight behind them that suggests something more spectral than earthly. While this encounter may sound like something out of a fairytale for KCD2 , meeting this woman takes a more morbid tone.

What sets this strange woman apart isn’t just her unsettling presence but the way she speaks about Henry. She claims to have walked beside him many times, a statement that feels deeply personal yet disturbingly universal. Her familiarity with Henry’s violent journey implies she is tied to death itself or is actually death personified. In a game grounded so tightly in realism, it’s easy to miss how superstition weaves itself through the very Christian villages Henry travels through. The White Lady stands out as one of KCD2 ’s rare brushes with the surreal, bringing to life medieval myth and superstition.

Rare Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 NPC - Ambrose the Hermit

Tucked away in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is the story of Ambrose, a sick and dying hermit whose presence in the world is so fleeting that most players will only learn of him after he has already passed. Traditionally, Ambrose is found during The Hermit side quest, where Henry stumbles upon his secluded home and uncovers clues about the man’s reclusive life, but never the man himself. His fate, for many, is already sealed by the time players accept this quest with only his loot upon his grave to remember him by.

Most players find Ambrose deceased. However, those who veer off the beaten path and visit his hut under just the right conditions, before the quest officially begins, may actually meet Ambrose while he is still struggling to cling to life. The encounter is quiet and tragic. He’s frail, introspective, and acutely aware that his end is near. Ambrose does not offer the player much but a few lines of dialogue, only the chance to speak with a man who has chosen solitude for his final days. It’s a rare moment of intimacy, the kind of fleeting human connection that makes KCD2 ’s world feel lived-in, reactive, and painfully mortal.

Rare Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 NPC - Jezhek of Holohlavy

Not every would-be thief on the roads of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is what they seem. Jezhek of Holohlavy is a rare encounter that blurs the line between knave and knight, offering players a surprisingly human story hidden behind a shaky blade and a desperate ambush. He appears along the roadside, halting Henry’s travels with a half-hearted attempt at robbery. But it quickly becomes apparent that Jezhek isn’t cut out for this life. Players who are keen on killing KCD2 NPCs should hear Jezhek out. His armor is gone. His honor, tattered. And his desperation runs deeper than his swordsmanship. Jezhek met his fate by challenging a commander in Sigismund’s army who wanted to raze a village. His good deed caused him dishonor, so he had to surrender his gear and has been wandering in shame ever since.

If players choose not to cut him down immediately, Jezhek explains his story and offers the quest Lost Honor, which tasks Henry with recovering his lost arms from Commander Zavish of Garbow. It’s one of those moments that makes the world of KCD2 feel heavier, where even would-be enemies carry burdens worth understanding. Mercy, in this case, is the key to uncovering a rare and personal quest, and perhaps helping a fellow knight find his way again.

12 Images
12 Images

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II is an exhilarating Action RPG, set amidst the chaos of a civil war in 15th Century Bohemia.

You are Henry of Skalitz – an ordinary man doing extraordinary things – caught in a gripping tale of revenge, betrayal, and discovery as he embarks on an epic journey, 'from a humble blacksmith's forge to the court of Kings', searching for purpose in this beautiful but brutal medieval world.

From bustling city streets to lush forests, explore this open-world Medieval Europe through an unforgettable adventure filled with action, thrills, and wonder.

item.title: Path Of Exile 2: Most Expensive Items, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Valued trade items in PoE 2 include high-tier waystones, high-level skill gems, and unique relics.
  • Prices on the trade site vary, with some items selling for Divine Orbs or even a Mirror of Kalandra.
  • Rare gear items with high rolls can be as valuable or more than unique items due to their stats.

The most recent update for Path Of Exile 2 , Dawn of the Hunt , reset the economy with a new trading league. Item trading is a core part of Path of Exile 2 for many players, whether that's trading for the best items for their build, trading for upgrade currency, or trading for the best endgame maps for even better farming opportunities.

The Path of Exile 2 official trading site can be accessed directly in-game or via browser, and this is where players list their items and bid on others. Since RNG determines everything from the stats on a player's gear to how they earn more endgame maps to farm, relying on luck alone can be a recipe for disaster in PoE 2 , and the trade market is a great way to fill in the gaps.

Values on the trade site are determined entirely by the players and can vary wildly, but items that are bought frequently tend to settle on an average price point after a while. Most trades are valued in Exalted or Divine Orbs, as these upgrade currencies are both useful enough to be valuable to all players and common enough to be traded frequently. For players who want a quick overview of what's currently most valued, these are the most expensive items on the Path of Exile 2 trade site, ranked by category.

7 High Tier Waystones

Endgame Maps With Desirable Modifiers

  • Average Price: 10 to 100 Exalted Orbs

Waystone maps at tier 15 can fetch a high price on the trade market, especially if they roll with modifiers that players are going to want, like increased pack size or increased rare monster spawns.

Prices on tier 15 waystones can vary wildly, with some players asking up to 15 Divine Orbs for particularly well-rolled maps, but an average tier 15 can be found for anywhere between 10 and 100 Exalted Orbs if players search the trade site. Maps with a high waystone drop chance, maps that roll more positive than negative modifiers, and maps that roll with increased item rarity modifiers all fetch a premium price.

6 High Level Skill Gems

Skill Switching Convenience And Skipping The Grind

  • Average Price: 15 to 17 Divine Orbs

High-quality, high-level skill gems are always in demand. To fetch the highest price, the gem has to be max level (20), max quality (20%), have five sockets, and be corrupted with +1 to the skill's level.

Players will happily pay for these maxed-out skill gems, as the time and currency investment required to get a skill to this level through gameplay is significant. Highly-valued tier three support gems can also fetch a decent price, though not quite as much as a maxed-out skill gem, as it's much easier for players to obtain tier three supports naturally.

5 Unique Relics

Guaranteed Trial Boss Uniques

  • Average Price: 10 to 100 Divine Orbs

The unique relics that can be used in the Trial of the Sekhemas can fetch a huge price on the trade market. These items will cause the final trial boss, Zarokh the Temporal, to drop specific unique gear when defeated, making them valuable farming tools.

The most valuable of these relics currently is the Last Flame Incense Relic, which results in the boss dropping the Temporalis, a much-sought-after unique item. The prices drop dramatically for the less popular unique relics, but they're still worth around 10 Divine Orbs for a Desperate Alliance or Peace Maker's Draught.

4 Precursor Tablets

Endgame Mapping Enhancers

  • Average Price: Up to 200 Divine Orbs or 1 Mirror of Kalandra

Unique precursor tablets are a highly prized endgame mapping item. These tablets can be used in Towers on the Atlas to give specific properties to maps in their range. The most popular tablets are those that add endgame activities like Breaches, Rituals, guaranteed boss fights, Delirium Mirrors, or the new Azmeri Wisps.

There are currently some very high prices for well-rolled precursor tablets, with players asking hundreds of Divine Orbs or even ultra-rare currencies like the Mirror of Kalandra, but more frugal trade users can also pick up some pretty good unique precursors for around 20 Divine Orbs.

3 Omens

Passive Benefits

  • Average Price: 200 Divine Orbs

Players who are looking to craft the perfect endgame gear value Omens highly. That's because these endgame currency items, obtained with Ritual favor, can influence crafting outcomes in guaranteed ways, such as guaranteeing an Alchemy Orb will roll the maximum number of suffix modifiers. That's not all, as there are also Omens with powerful gameplay effects, like fully restoring flask charges when the player drops to low life.

Once an Omen is activated in the player's inventory, it will take effect when its condition is met. Omens are single-use items, but even so, their value is regularly around 200 Divine Orbs and can be even more for the most sought-after varieties.

2 Named Uniques

Buildcrafting Pieces

  • Average Price: 500 Divine Orbs

The most sought-after uniques in Path of Exile 2 are those that grant effects that synergize well with particular builds. The most prized, well-rolled weapons will sell even at astronomical currency prices, but a desirable unique often goes for around 500 Divine Orbs on average. The most expensive uniques on the trade site tend to be valued in Mirrors of Kalandra, with some players selling well-rolled uniques for 5 to 10 of this rare endgame currency.

1 High Roll Rares

Highly Desirable Stats

  • Average Price: 500 Divine Orbs / 1 Mirror of Kalandra

The way that modifiers work in Path of Exile 2 means that a well-rolled rare gear item can be as valuable as any unique item, if not more so. A weapon with particularly high damage rolls for physical or elemental stats, or an armor piece with a high primary defensive roll and triple resistances, for example, will often offer far more flat benefit to a character's stats than a unique in the same slot.

As such, it's easy to find well-rolled rares on the trade site selling for as much as some of the more desirable unique gear items.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Is Adding Costume Customization
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel Rivals is adding a costume customization feature on April 17.
  • Doctor Strange is receiving a new skin based on the MCU film Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness.
  • Players can claim new skins for Magik and Iron Fist with the free version of the Season 2 battle pass.

Marvel Rivals has announced that it will be adding a new costume customization feature to the popular hero shooter on April 17 at 2 AM PDT. NetEase Games recently released Season 2: Hellfire Gala and debuted a new map of Krakoa in Marvel Rivals , which features a large statue of Professor X. While unconfirmed, many people seem to think the developers are teasing the arrival of the powerful mutant in the near future.

The popular hero shooter recently showcased a new costume for Doctor Strange in Marvel Rivals based on his appearance near the end of the MCU film Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness . The fresh skin gives the Vanguard a zombie makeover, showing off his grotesque body with numerous hands sprouting from his shoulders. His usual flowing red cloak has also taken on a sinister look, as the fabric seems to have been replaced by dark wisps of magic. While there's no official word on just how much the cosmetic bundle will cost, players will be able to get their own hands on the skin on April 17 at 7 PM PDT.

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games revealed that it will be adding a costume customization feature to popular outfits on April 17 at 2 AM PDT. The characters shown in the announcement image were Marvel Rivals Magik, Winter Soldier, Luna Snow, and Psylocke. Magik's punk-themed outfit will be receiving a recolor called Rosy Resilience, while Psylocke's Vengeance costume will be getting a new style called Phantom Purple. Luna Snow's 2099 outfit will be receiving a Plasma Pulse makeover, and Winter Soldier's vampire-themed costume will be getting a new style called Winter's Wrath. While these are the only heroes shown in the preview image, it's always possible that NetEase Games could introduce even more costume customization options when the patch officially launches.

Marvel Rivals Is Adding More Costume Styles on April 17

The new feature was teased by the developers leading up to Season 2 of Marvel Rivals , but fans were never given a timeline or release date. In order to take advantage of the new cosmetic options, fans will need to go to the game's store and claim the new styles for free. After that, the new option will be available to choose in the costume tab for the corresponding hero.

Gamers looking to collect more free cosmetics might want to consider completing challenges to earn Chrono Tokens. While every skin in the battle pass can be earned after buying it, players can claim skins for Magik and Iron Fist in Marvel Rivals without purchasing the pass. With the new costume customization feature on the way and even more updates to look forward to, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Roblox: +1 Hot Every Second Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All +1 Hot Every Second Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for +1 Hot Every Second
  • How to Get More +1 Hot Every Second Codes

+1 Hot Every Second is a dynamic Roblox time-killer where your goal will be to accumulate Hot to fight enemies and get to the leaderboard. The process of accumulating Hot is time-consuming, but you can speed it up significantly by buying pets, upgrades, and occupying one of the zones with an additional earnings multiplier.

If you're a beginner, it's hard to achieve, but don't worry, because you can redeem +1 Hot Every Second codes. Each of the codes will reward you with tons of Hot, and other useful gifts that will greatly speed up your progression in the game and make you more competitive.

All +1 Hot Every Second Codes

Working +1 Hot Every Second Codes

  • 20000 Likes - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • megacool - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • 100 likes - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • FlorizDev - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.

Expired +1 Hot Every Second Codes

There are currently no expired +1 Hot Every Second codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Redeeming +1 Hot Every Second codes will be especially useful for beginners because from the beginning of the game, you earn a meager amount of Hot, and other players will start killing you without even thinking. After receiving rewards, you will be able to significantly advance in the game and gain an advantage over those who have previously bothered you.

How to Redeem Codes for +1 Hot Every Second

Before you can redeem the codes, you need to fulfill certain conditions, namely, subscribe to the Roblox page of the game developer and like the game. Once you've done that, use our guide to learn how to find the redemption option and get your rewards in this Roblox game:

  • Launch +1 Hot Every Second .
  • In the main lobby, look around. Opposite the soccer field, you will see a pedestal with a verification icon and the inscription Redeem Codes. Approach the pedestal.
  • This will open the redemption menu. Before you can redeem the codes, you will need to complete the subscription verification we mentioned above. After fulfilling the conditions, paste your Roblox username into the input field and click the Verify button.
  • After doing this, a field for entering codes and a green Enter button will appear in the menu. Now, enter one of the active codes from the list above into the input field.
  • Lastly, press the green Enter button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More +1 Hot Every Second Codes

We are working hard to find all the Roblox codes, and you can always check the actual list on this page. If you want to search for codes manually, we have prepared a list of links to the official game resources where developers publish them from time to time:

  • Official +1 Hot Every Second Roblox group.
  • Official +1 Hot Every Second game page.
  • Official +1 Hot Every Second Discord server.
  • Official +1 Hot Every Second X account.
